  • Take the Pledge!

Smartphones are powerful tools. With the device in our pocket, we can communicate with millions of people, take photos, and access nearly all the information known to man. But since the advent of these devices, people aren't getting closer. If anything, we're getting further apart.

The average person spends four hours of their life using their smartphones, time that they could be spending with people, or doing more useful things.

Take the #VibPledge!

Now that you've made your pledge, here's how you're going to quit overusing your smartphone.

The 12-Step Program

  1. Don't sleep with your phone. Ever. If you live with your parents, a roomate, or someone else, ask them to keep it overnight, and charge it in their room. If not, shut your phone all the way down when you get in bed.
  2. Delete apps you don't really need. This includes those you use a lot. For example, if you spend large amounts of time browsing Instagram by reflex, try deleting it and seeing how you do. Delete all games.
  3. Try to use your phone for two days on a single charge (or only partially charge your phone every day). This will force you to use your phone less to conserve battery and only use it for what's important.
  4. Take a break from a specific app for a specific period of time and dedicate that free time to learning or doing something new, like learning shorthand or excercising.
  5. If you want to be extreme, you can cheaply purchase a non-smart phone on eBay and put your smartphone away for a while—or even sell it, if you're REALLY exreme.
